Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Mummy breast cover
Description: Trapezoid-shape mummy cover with rounded bottom. From top to bottom: a winged solar disc flanked by the two falcon heads of the wesekh-collar. On the collar, a pectoral adorned with three crouched mummiform deities, facing right (probably Isis, Osiris and Nephthys). On either side of the collar, two mummiform figures: Sokar on the right and Osiris on the left. Below, a winged scarab. A mummification scene presided by Anubis (canopic jars under the bed) flanked by Isis on the right and Nephthys on the left. A kneeling, winged goddess (Nut) with out-strected wings, holding Maat feathers. On either side of a door the four sons of Horus, mummiform. On the right, probably Qebehsenuf and Duamutef. Black contours. White background (plaster).
